alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 09 at 5:25AM AKST until January 10 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 9 AM AKST MONDAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 11 inches. Winds gusting as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...From noon today to 9 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds will be this morning through early afternoon before starting to taper off. They will however remain strong enough to cause severely restricted visibility through Mon morning.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
